intro: Tanacetum chiliophyllum var. heimerlei, commonly known as the Heimerlei tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves and yellow button-like flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained, moist soils in partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a long history of use in traditional medicine.
